questions.question: What is the purpose of JavaScript frameworks?
options: To simplify and streamline web development

questions.question: Which JavaScript framework is known for its virtual DOM?
What is the main difference between JavaScript libraries and frameworks?
options: Libraries provide pre-written functions, while frameworks dictate the structure of the application
Libraries dictate the structure of the application, while frameworks provide pre-written functions
Libraries are used for backend development, while frameworks are for frontend

questions.question: Which JavaScript framework is popular for building single-page applications?
What is the purpose of a JavaScript transpiler like Babel?
options: To convert modern JavaScript code into backward-compatible code
To convert JavaScript into other languages

questions.question: What does AJAX stand for in the context of JavaScript?
Which JavaScript framework is known for its two-way data binding?
What is a JavaScript promise?
options: A guarantee that a function will return a value
A guarantee that a function will execute
A guarantee that a function will not return a value
A guarantee that a function will throw an error

questions.question: Which JavaScript feature is used to iterate over items in an array?
What is the purpose of JavaScript closures?
options: To protect variables from being modified
To create private variables and functions

questions.question: What does the 'this' keyword refer to in JavaScript?
options: The element that triggered the event

questions.question: What is the purpose of the 'use strict' directive in JavaScript?
options: To enable strict mode, which catches common coding mistakes
To enforce stricter security measures in the browser
To allow the use of experimental features

questions.question: Which method is used to add a new item to the end of an array in JavaScript?
What does the 'typeof' operator return for a JavaScript function?
What is the purpose of the 'async' and 'await' keywords in JavaScript?
options: To handle asynchronous code more elegantly using promises
To force synchronous execution of asynchronous code
To pause code execution until a condition is met
